topic.topicDialog:
Once you've accessed the Kerboodle Book, you can personalise it by adding notes and annotations.

This tutorial will take you through a few of the options available, for a full list of tools and their uses, please refer to the Kerboodle User Guide.

step.stepTextTip: Access your Kerboodle Book and launch the page you'd like to annotate.

Notes:

To add notes to your page, select one of the 'Note' options from the toolbar.

Click on the page to activate the tool and complete the pop-up.
The note will then remain on the page and can be opened at any time by clicking on the icon.

Links:

To add weblinks (or links to other pages) to your book, select one of the 'Link' options from the toolbar.

Click on the page to activate the tool and complete the pop-up.
The link will then remain on the page and can be opened at any time by clicking on the icon.

Draw: A pen tool is available to draw on the book page, and there is also a really useful highlight tool.

To highlight text on the page, select the Highlight Marker and choose your colour.
Click and drag the highlight marker over the text you would like to highlight.
Once you've finished annotating the page, click on the Save button in the main toolbar to save your changes.
